', '(2018)', 'Edited by Abhijit Banerjee et al', 'Pratham, New Delhi, India.', 'Pratham, New Delhi, India; 2017.', '(2 Written by Sarah B', 'In this post, I am sharing some tips that you can use to stay productive while working from home (WFH)', 'This should include both short term and long-term goals that you want to achieve in your personal as well as professional life during this period', 'While these tasks seem trivial to some of us they can be crucial in helping maintain an organized life that is free of distractions which might cause stress and anxiety!', 'One way where most people could benefit immensely from this situation would by getting familiar with some digital tools that can help make your life easier while working remotely such as; Zoom or Skype calls instead of traditional phone conversations, Google Docs for collaborative editing projects etc', 'It‚Äôs essential to stay in touch with family members and friends since we cannot physically meet them like before due to social distancing norms! You can use different platforms such as Whatsapp or Facebook messenger group which provides an easy way for everyone involved on both ends of communication lines without any hassle.', 'Therefore, it is recommended that we take 10 minutes out of every hour during WFH and step away from computers while doing something else like going outside for some fresh air or just taking a quick nap on couch etc., this will help refresh our minds thus enhancing productivity levels back up again once these breaks are over.', 'Eating regularly throughout the day will ensure that you don‚Äôt feel low on energy which might hamper your concentration levels thus reducing productivity altogether thereby making it difficult for us to finish tasks within deadline periods too!', 'because socializing helps in maintaining our sanity while being stuck indoors amidst this pandemic situation without getting bored out of one‚Äôs wits due to lack thereof interaction among peers which can further deteriorate mental health over prolonged period if not attended upon timely enough!', 'Follow them religiously and make sure that your work from home experience becomes a fulfilling one rather than just another task on an endless to-do list for days ahead', 'Hosseini is currently pursuing her Masters in Economics at the University of Illinois Chicago and working as a Research Associate for Social Policy Analytics, LLC', 'She also holds an MBA degree from DeVry University with concentration on Finance & Accounting']

['Groovy: A popular slang term from the 1960s that represented something cool or attractive, reflecting the free-spirited and rebellious nature of Mod culture.', "Hippie: Reflecting the countercultural movement of the '60s, individuals who embraced alternative lifestyles, peace, love, and communal living were often called hippies.", 'Tune-up: A term associated with car maintenance that became popular among young people in the 1960s as a symbol of youthful independence.', 'Mod (short for "Modernist") fashion: This style was characterized by tailored suits, fitted jackets, slim ties, and skinny jeans, all reflecting sophistication and rebellion against traditional norms.', "Mini-skirt: A short skirt that became a symbol of the youthful counterculture movement in the '60s, challenging conservative fashion norms.", 'Bubblegum rock: A genre of music characterized by its catchy melodies and simple lyrics, popular among young people during this era', "Peace symbol: Originally a representation of nuclear disarmament in the 1950s, it evolved into an emblem for peace and love during the '60s counterculture movement.", 'Woodstock: A famous music festival held in August 1969 that showcased counter-cultural ideals such as peace, love, and communal living through its massive gathering of people.', "Psychedelic art: Characterized by vibrant colors, swirling patterns, and dreamlike imagery, this style was heavily associated with the '60s youth counterculture movement, reflecting their interest in altered states of consciousness and experimentation.", 'Free love: A concept advocating for sexual freedom and rejecting societal norms related to marriage and monogamy', "Radical chic: Reflecting the fusion of high-class, sophisticated lifestyles with progressive social activism that emerged among some '60s elites as they supported civil rights and other causes.", 'Commune: Living in a communal setting where resources are shared collectively was an alternative living arrangement embraced by some countercultural movements of the 1960s.', 'Anti-war protesters: Young people who actively opposed US involvement in the Vietnam War, often organizing rallies and demonstrations during this era.', '"Hair" (a song by The Byrds): A symbol of youth rebellion and counterculture, as it celebrated individuality and nonconformity to mainstream society.', 'Counterculture: Refers broadly to the various movements that rejected traditional values and norms in the 1960s, often advocating for social change and experimentation with lifestyles.', "Groundbreaking: A term used to describe innovative or unconventional ideas, events, or individuals within the '60s counterculture movement.", "Hippies: Countercultural youth who embraced peace, love, and alternative lifestyles as a reaction against mainstream society's values during this era.", 'Woodstock Festival (also known simply as "Woodstock"): A three-day music festival held in 1969 that showcased the countercultural ideals of peace, love, and communal living among young people.', "Psychedelic: Refers to mind-altering substances like LSD or peyote that were often used by members of the '60s counterculture movement to explore consciousness and challenge societal norms.", 'Mod subculture: Originated in London during the early 1960s, characterized by its sophisticated fashion sense and rejection of mainstream values in favor of an individualistic expression of identity.']
